intro: Cacalia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Cacalia stenophylla is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of certain soil conditions.
